Class UnitManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • UnitManager

  • public class UnitManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Manage all units including the player and other character Handles the creations, actions, updates and renderings

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UnitManager(java.lang.String unitPosPath, java.lang.String unitDataPath, java.lang.String unitDialoguePath)
      Instantiates a new unit manager.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UnitManager

        public UnitManager(java.lang.String unitPosPath,
                   java.lang.String unitDataPath,
                   java.lang.String unitDialoguePath)
            throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException
        Instantiates a new unit manager. Read needed data files and initialise all units
        Parameters:
        unitPosPath - the path of the .dat file containing all positions
        unitDataPath - the path of the .txt file containing all other data
        unitDialoguePath - the path of the .txt file containing all dialogues
        Throws:
        org.newdawn.slick.SlickException - the slick exception

    • Method Detail

      • getPlayer

        public static Player getPlayer()
        Gets the player.
        Returns:
        the player

      • update

        public void update(int dir_x,
                   int dir_y,
                   boolean isTDown,
                   boolean isADown,
                   World world,
                   int delta)
        Update all units and perform the corresponding actions .
        Parameters:
        dir_x - The player's movement in the x axis (-1, 0 or 1).
        dir_y - The player's movement in the y axis (-1, 0 or 1).
        isTDown - The player's talk action
        isADown - The player's attack action
        world - The world all units are on, to check terrain blocking
        delta - Time passed since last frame (milliseconds).

      • render

        public void render(org.newdawn.slick.Graphics g,
                   Camera camera)
        Render the player and other characters when they are in the range of camera
        Parameters:
        g - The Slick graphics object, used for drawing.
        camera - The camera object, used for determining the bound of rendering
